commentBody: The author can't seem to put a finger on what the term "bro" signifies, who it applies to, or why anyone should care about how it is used. About the only thing that comes through clearly in this piece is his smug, dismissive condescension towards straight white males. "Keep your mouth shut and your legs closed." Hmm. Would the NY Times publish that sentence - even in jest - if it were directed towards any other group? Is there a catch-all term - the anti "bro" - for folks who casually casually insult and demean this particular segment of the population? There should be but there isn't (although when people rail against "political correctness" this is kind of what they are getting at). And again and again people on the left wonder where the anger and the support for Trump is coming from . . .

replies.commentBody: The fact that there really isn't an anti-bro term probably indicates the term bro isn't binary, so it's up to "creative" people to create meanings and interpretations that have nothing to do with reality.
